Ohio Republicans: significant gains during Chris McNulty's time at the ORP, including the successful re-election of President Bush in Ohio, as stated by Ohio GOP Chairman Bob Bennett.
McNulty: s tenure at the Ohio GOP, starting in 1995 as a field representative and later becoming political director in 1997 and executive director in 2001.
The Republican Party: s control of nonjudicial statewide posts in the 1998 and 2002 elections and their control of the General Assembly through 2008, which allowed them to maintain power in redistricting.
The party: s success in the 2000 presidential election, with George W. Bush winning Ohio's electoral votes, and the subsequent gains made under new congressional lines in 2002, where the party picked up a seat while Democrats lost two.
